Kemnaker Pantau Penetapan UMP 2020
04 Nov 2019, 08:11 by Tempo.co
INFO NASIONAL - Dirjen Pembinaan Hubungan Industrial dan Jaminan Sosial Tenaga Kerja (PHI dan Jamsos) Kementerian Ketenagakerjaan, Haiyani Rumondang mengatakan sampai saat ini pihak Kemnaker masih melakukan pemantauan penetapan Upah Minimum Provinsi (UMP) oleh para Gubernur.
"Hari ini kita terus melakukan pemantauan dan pengumpulan laporan penetapan UMP dari daerah-daerah dari seluruh Indonesia," kata Dirjen Haiyani dalam keterangan pers Biro Humas Kemnaker di Jakarta pada Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Kenaikan UMP 2020 dihitung berdasarkan formula yang sesuai dengan Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) Nomor 78 Tahun 2015 tentang pengupahan.
Adapun penetapan UMP 2020 berdasarkan Pasal 9 Peraturan Menteri Ketenagakerjaan Nomor 15 Tahun 2018 tentang Upah Minimum ditetapkan dan diumumkan secara serentak oleh Gubernur setiap daerah pada tanggal 1 November 2019 dengan keputusan gubernur.
"Jadi intinya untuk menetapkan UMP tahun 2020 merupakan kewenangan Gubernur. Berdasarkan data Inflasi dan Pertumbuhan Ekonomi Nasional dari BPS kenaikan Upah Minimum Provinsi (UMP) 2020 sebesar 8,51%," ujar Haiyani.
"Memang hari ini diumumkan, kalau itu semua sudah tahu aturannya. Kita tunggu saja pengumuman penetapan UMP oleh para gubernur hari ini," katanya menambahkan.
Direktur Pengupahan Kemnaker, Dinar Titus Jogaswitani mengatakan, hingga saat ini (Pukul 18:00 tanggal 1 November 2019), 20 Provinsi telah mengumumkan penetapan dan menyampaikan laporan tentang penetapan upah minimum provinsi (UMP) 2020 kepada Kemnaker.
Dari 20 provinsi yang telah menyampaikan laporan tentang besaran UMP tersebut, sebanyak 19 sudah sesuai dengan Peraturan Pemerintah Nomor 78 Tahun 2015 tentang Pengupahan.
"Sampai sore ini terpantau 20 provinsi yang telah menetapkan UMP oleh gubernur. Namun 1 provinsi diantaranya masih tidak sesuai dengan ketetapan, " kata Dinar.
Mengenai provinsi- provinsi yang belum menyampaikan laporannya, Dinar menduga bisa saja sudah diumumkan namun laporannya masih menyusul karena Keputusannya belum ditandatangani oleh Gubernur atau belum disampaikan kepada Kemnaker.
Sebelumnya, Menteri Ketenagakerjaan, M Hanif Dhakiri telah merilis surat soal data inflasi Nasional dan Pertumbuhan ekonomi tahun 2019 yang dipergunakan sebagai dasar perhitungan kenaikan Upah Minimum Provinsi (UMP) tahun 2020 pada 15 Oktober 2019.
Surat edaran bernomor B-M/308/HI.01.00/X/2019 ihwal penyampaian data tingkat inflasi nasional dan pertumbuhan produk domestik bruto tahun 2019. Sesuai dengan Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) No. 78 terkait Pengupahan, parameter di atas menjadi perhitungan kenaikan UMP tahun berikutnya.
Surat edaran tersebut menjelaskan bahwa berdasarkan data BPS, inflasi nasional tercatat 3,39% dan pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional 5,12%, yang kemudian diakumulasi jadi besaran kenaikan UMP 2020.(*)

Ministry of Manpower Monitor UMP 2020 Determination
Nov 04 2019, 08:11 by Tempo.co
NATIONAL INFO - Director General of Industrial Relations Development and Labor Social Security (PHI and Jamsos) Ministry of Manpower, Haiyani Rumondang said that until now the Ministry of Manpower is still monitoring the establishment of Provincial Minimum Wages (UMP) by the Governors.
"Today we continue to monitor and compile reports on the determination of UMP from regions from all over Indonesia," Director General Haiyani said in a press release at the Ministry of Manpower Public Relations Bureau in Jakarta on Friday, November 1, 2019.
UMP 2020 increase is calculated based on a formula in accordance with Government Regulation (PP) No. 78 of 2015 concerning wages.
The stipulation of the UMP 2020 based on Article 9 of the Minister of Manpower Regulation Number 15 of 2018 concerning Minimum Wages is stipulated and announced simultaneously by the Governor of each region on November 1, 2019 with the governor's decision.
"So the point is to determine the 2020 UMP is the authority of the Governor. Based on data from Inflation and National Economic Growth from BPS, the increase in the 2020 Provincial Minimum Wage (UMP) is 8.51%," Haiyani said.
"Indeed, today it was announced, if it all knew the rules. We will wait for the announcement of the establishment of the UMP by the governors today," he added.
The Ministry of Manpower Wage Director, Dinar Titus Jogaswitani said, to date (18:00 on 1 November 2019), 20 Provinces have announced the stipulation and submitted a report on setting the 2020 provincial minimum wage (UMP) to the Ministry of Manpower.
Of the 20 provinces that have submitted reports on the amount of the UMP, as many as 19 are in accordance with Government Regulation Number 78 of 2015 concerning Wages.
"As of this afternoon 20 provinces have been set up by the governor to monitor the UMP. However, 1 of them is still not in accordance with the provisions," said Dinar.
Regarding the provinces that have not submitted their reports, Dinar suspects that it could have been announced but the report is still following because the decision has not been signed by the Governor or has not been submitted to the Ministry of Manpower.
Previously, the Minister of Manpower, M Hanif Dhakiri, had released a letter concerning data on National inflation and economic growth in 2019 which was used as a basis for calculating the increase in the Provincial Minimum Wage (UMP) in 2020 on October 15, 2019.
Circular numbered B-M / 308 / HI.01.00 / X / 2019 concerning the delivery of data on national inflation rates and gross domestic product growth in 2019. In accordance with Government Regulation (PP) No. 78 related to Wages, the parameters above become the calculation of the next year's UMP increase.
The circular explained that based on BPS data, national inflation was recorded at 3.39% and national economic growth was 5.12%, which was then accumulated to become the amount of the 2020 UMP increase. (*)
